goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Through-cycle σ=0.18 excludes 2021-2022 COVID spike anomaly

hrc_price_factor.rationale: Mean-reverting to through-cycle baseline (E[X]=1.0). Through-cycle σ=0.18 vs full-period σ=0.264. Bloomberg data: pre-COVID σ=0.208, post-COVID σ=0.388, ex-COVID σ=0.235. Chosen σ is conservative vs pre-COVID (forward-looking 10yr horizon averages out extremes).

crc_price_factor.rationale: Mean-reverting to through-cycle baseline (E[X]=1.0). Through-cycle volatility (σ=0.16). High correlation with HRC.

goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Through-cycle σ=0.22 reflects oil/gas cyclicality without COVID anomaly

octg_price_factor.rationale: Mean-reverting to through-cycle baseline (E[X]=1.0). Through-cycle σ=0.22 retains higher vol than flat-rolled due to oil/gas cyclicality.

goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Through-cycle σ=0.15, slightly less volatile than CRC

coated_price_factor.rationale: Mean-reverting to through-cycle baseline (E[X]=1.0). Through-cycle σ=0.15, slightly less volatile than CRC due to value-added premium stability.

flat_rolled_volume.rationale: Based on 464 weekly US capacity utilization readings. Normal distribution reflects symmetric demand shocks.

mini_mill_volume.rationale: Mini-mills are less cyclical than integrated. Volatility reduced by 25% from flat-rolled.

goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Range tightened from raw rig count data to exclude extreme COVID/shale collapse scenarios

tubular_volume.rationale: Tubular demand driven by oil/gas drilling activity. Through-cycle range [0.65, 1.35] excludes extreme rig count collapse (2020) and boom (2014). Mean = 1.0.

uss_wacc.rationale: Composite of 10Y Treasury yield distribution and BBB credit spread. Mean of 10.9% reflects current calculation; std of 0.8% reflects combined rate and spread uncertainty.

japan_rf_rate.rationale: Japan 10Y JGB yields anchored by BOJ policy. Low volatility reflects yield curve control history.

terminal_growth.rationale: Terminal growth bounded by long-term industry outlook. Min=-0.5% (secular decline), Mode=1.0% (GDP match), Max=2.5% (reinvestment).

exit_multiple.rationale: Steel sector EV/EBITDA multiples. Min=3.5x (trough), Mode=4.5x (mid-cycle), Max=6.5x (peak). Reflects commodity cyclicality.

gary_works_execution.rationale: Gary Works BF reline is proven technology. Beta(8,3) gives mean ~73% success, skewed toward full execution. Based on historical BF project execution rates.

mon_valley_execution.rationale: Mon Valley HSM is equipment upgrade, lower complexity. Beta(9,2) gives mean ~82% success with high confidence.

goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Range tightened to ±15% — margins are more stable than prices

flat_rolled_margin_factor.rationale: Based on peer EBITDA margin observations. Through-cycle range [0.85, 1.15] reflects margin stability relative to price volatility. Margins compress in downturns but are partially offset by cost adjustments.

operating_synergy_factor.rationale: M&A literature shows 70-85% operating synergy realization rate. Beta(8,3) gives mean ~82% with positive skew toward success.

revenue_synergy_factor.rationale: Revenue synergies historically harder to achieve than cost synergies. Beta(3,4) gives mean ~55% with wider uncertainty band.

working_capital_efficiency.rationale: Working capital efficiency varies with commodity cycles. Normal with 8% volatility reflects typical industry variation.

capex_intensity_factor.rationale: CapEx intensity varies with cycle and strategic priorities. Triangular captures potential for above/below-plan spending.

us_10yr.rationale: US 10Y Treasury rate affects IRP WACC calculation. Based on recent rate volatility (2023-2024 range ~3.5-5%).

nippon_erp.rationale: Nippon equity risk premium. Japanese market ERP estimates range 4-6% in academic literature.

annual_price_growth.rationale: Annual steel price growth rate (%). Mean of 1.0% reflects long-term inflation-linked growth for commodity steel. Std of 1% allows for -1% to +3% in 95% of cases.

usse_volume.rationale: USSE (European) volume factor. Higher volatility than US due to energy cost exposure and import competition.

goodness_of_fit.calibration_note: Through-cycle σ=0.15 from Bloomberg data (full-period σ=0.156, pre-COVID σ=0.116)

hrc_eu_factor.rationale: Mean-reverting to through-cycle baseline (E[X]=1.0). EU HRC is less volatile than US (σ=0.15 vs 0.18) due to different market structure and import competition.

tariff_probability.rationale: P(tariffs maintained at 25%) ~80%. Beta(8,2) gives mean=0.80, right-skewed toward tariff maintenance. Reflects political inertia and bipartisan support for steel tariffs.

tariff_rate_if_changed.rationale: If tariff policy changes, most likely outcome is reduction to ~10% (compromise rate). Full removal (0%) is tail risk. Max at current 25% (no increase modeled here since tariff_probability handles that).

notes: Data cutoff: 2023-12-18 (USS Board approved Nippon deal)
Price factors fitted to pre-deal historical data only
Beta used for execution success (bounded 0-1, skewed)
Correlations from Bloomberg data where available
